As far as everyone talking about how horrible the staff is and how expensive it is, I say 1) if you're going rock climbing, expect to spend money, 2) the staff was nice. They also have a mini gym, and weights, and a shower and shoe rentals.

This is not a great place to go to have fun climbing with an easy-going crowd.  If you just want to have fun without a whole lot of competitive/cultish B.S., go to Beach City Rocks.This place is loaded with newly on-the-wagon AA types trying to manage their addictions by going to the gym.  No fun. No thanks.  The preening is ridiculous too.I am still trying to figure out how, exactly, that's supposed to be a good place for kids.  Birthday parties? Not so much...You will note all of the other reviews are from very enthusiastic climbers.  If those other reviews sound more like you and you like working out in B.O.-ville , then it is probably a good gym.

I signed up for the yearly membership and paid in full up front.  I didn't use the gym for 5 months due to family problems.  They are only willing to extend it for 2 months after paying $20 fee.   Please DO NOT PREPAY nor sign up for the yearly membership.  It's cheaper to pay as you go.  Also, if you are taking lessons, you don't have to pay to get in.

I went to Rockreation for about two weeks with a groupon deal and was pretty impressed.  I went through the belay class which was a really helpful brush-up course even though I'd done rock climbing before.  All the staff were really nice and helpful.  I liked that they have so many different walls and courses available so you never have to wait to climb and can always find a challenging enough course that is available.  The parking lot was usually full but street parking is totally doable and available in the immediate vicinity so it wasn't an issue for me.  The only thing that kind of sucks is that they don't have the self-propelling device on their walls like some other places do.  As a result, you basically always need to go with a partner unless you want to only climb the bouldering wall or if don't mind trying to make new friends on a whim.

The actual climbing and gym portion of this facility is quite nice, but due to their management I can't help but only give them one star.  What good is a decent facility if you can't trust the management to treat their customers right.  I quit this gym officially and formally about 2 years ago and since then have had nothing but hassle because they will keep your billing information on file and then continuously "accidently" charge you for a yearly membership out of the blue.  The steps to get in contact with their billing department to have these charges removed are ridiculous.  You have to email a certain person who takes weeks to get back to you and even then I had to repeatedly call them to remind them that they hadn't reversed the charges.  Almost 2 months and a dozen phone calls later they finally reversed the charges.  This happened not once, but TWICE in the past 2 years that I haven't been a member.  Their excuse is always the same, that they have it on file that I officially was no longer a member, but they switched their systems over to another program and it automatically charged my account because they keep the billing information on file.  This is no way to run a business.  Not to mention I've never gotten good customer service there.  The facilities are fine, but the management just makes this place a big NO.

I just started climbing a few months ago and I love this gym!  The people that work there are AMAZING & have always been super helpful.  The routes have a variety of interesting challenges and new ones are always being added.

First of all I want to thank Matthew K. for putting together the UYE at Rockcreation the other day.  It was very cool to meet some fellow Yelper/Climbers and those aspiring as well.  Rockcreation was the first indoor gym that I checked out about ten years ago.  I had been climbing outside for a couple of years, so I found the novelty of pulling on plastic rather intriguing.  Every time I have gone to this place over the years, I have always gotten the same vibe from the staff and clientele.  You tend to get a lot of attitude from the newly arrived Westsiders who are aspiring to be an actor/model/pornstar/waiter.  I actually lived in West LA for two years only a couple of blocks away from Rockcreation and I could not force myself to join because I could not stand the attitude and unfriendly vibe of everyone there.  So how is the place now?  I was waiting to get a day pass at the front desk and the staff member had answered the phone and was very condescending with the person who wanted to do a group event.  I am still amazed in a down economy how people can get away with such crappy customer service.  The routes also were pretty sad and not very inspired.  There were only two routes on toprope that were over 11a and they were pretty featherbagged.  The lead cave seemed pretty cool and the bouldering alright, but overly packed and badly labeled.  Not worth the time unless you really have no other option, have plenty of money to spend on a substandard wall, and you have to get that plastic fix or you will go into withdrawal.
